intro: Lepidadenia ochracea, commonly known as the yellow sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Australia. It is a low-growing shrub with woody stems and small, clustered leaves that are typically covered in a fine, whitish coating. The plant produces yellow flowers that bloom in spring, attracting various pollinators such as bees and birds. Its adaptations to dry environments include reduced leaf size and deep root systems for water conservation. Lepidadenia ochracea is often found in sandy soils and is considered an important component of local ecosystems.
